Title has a typo. Maybe should test that it works with both values for `-permitbaremultisig`?

rename.from: test: Add test case for speding bare multisig
rename.to: test: Add test case for spending bare multisig

events.message:
test: Add test case for spending bare multisig

Co-authored-by: Anthony Towns <aj@erisian.com.au>

events.body: Could also update the documentation of the setting to clarify that it refers to the relay of transactions which create bare outputs, and not to the relay of transactions spending them?

I compiled with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28217, which sets default value of `permitbaremultisig` to false in `policy.h` and tried to run this test case with `'allowed': False` for expected result but the test fails. 
I would have expected that one to pass the test.

> I compiled with #28217, which sets default value of `permitbaremultisig` to false in `policy.h` and tried to run this test case with `'allowed': False` for expected result but the test fails. I would have expected that one to pass the test.

The test case already explicitly sets `permitbaremultisig=0`, so changing the default should have no effect. These spends should always be allowed, so if you change the test to assert that it's not allowed, the test should fail.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -372,5 +374,25 @@ def run_test(self):
             maxfeerate=0,
         )
 
+        self.log.info('Spending a confirmed bare multisig is okay')
+        node = self.nodes[0]

@@ -372,5 +374,24 @@ def run_test(self):
             maxfeerate=0,
         )
 
+        self.log.info('Spending a confirmed bare multisig is okay')
+        address = self.wallet.get_address()
+        tx = tx_from_hex(raw_tx_reference)
+        privkey, pubkey = generate_keypair()
+        tx.vout[0].scriptPubKey = keys_to_multisig_script([pubkey] * 3, k=1)  # Some bare multisig script (1-of-3)
comments.body:
test looks fine, would be best if we cover all the allowed and border cases:
1) n-of-m, where `1 <= n <= 3` as well as  `1 <= m <= 3` (do two loops)
2) too-large, i.e. n/m == 4
3) too-small(?) n/m==0

2/3 may require mining them into blocks directly if the outputs are non-standard to make

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -372,5 +374,24 @@ def run_test(self):
             maxfeerate=0,
         )
 
+        self.log.info('Spending a confirmed bare multisig is okay')
+        address = self.wallet.get_address()
+        tx = tx_from_hex(raw_tx_reference)
+        privkey, pubkey = generate_keypair()
+        tx.vout[0].scriptPubKey = keys_to_multisig_script([pubkey] * 3, k=1)  # Some bare multisig script (1-of-3)
comments.body:
> 2/3 may require mining them into blocks directly if the outputs are non-standard to make

`self.generateblock(node, address, [tx.serialize().hex()])` is already mining the tx-to-be-spent directly into a block.

2-of-3 shouldn't make any difference vs 1-of-3 or even 1-of-1 afaics. If the tx-to-be-spent is already confirmed, there shouldn't be any problem having a spend of a 20-of-20 checkmultisig in the mempool, so I don't think n/m=4 is actually an edge case. I think a 0-of-0 checkmultisig is also fine to spend, though is non-standard to create.

>  If the tx-to-be-spent is already confirmed, there shouldn't be any problem having a spend of a 20-of-20 checkmultisig in the mempool

we have tests for this? If not, this is probably the right thing to cover I guewss :)
